metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4133 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - negligible
metadata.Description:
kde-workspace before 4.10.5 has a memory leak in plasma desktop

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4133` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

freespacenotifier - 4:4.10.90-0ubuntu2
kde-style-oxygen - 4:4.10.90-0ubuntu2
kde-window-manager - 4:4.10.90-0ubuntu2
kde-window-manager-active - 4:4.10.90-0ubuntu2
kde-window-manager-common - 4:4.10.90-0ubuntu2
kde-workspace - 4:4.10.90-0ubuntu2
kde-workspace-bin - 4:4.10.90-0ubuntu2
kde-workspace-data - 4:4.10.90-0ubuntu2

kde-workspace-randr - 4:4.10.90-0ubuntu2

liblsofui4 - 4:4.10.90-0ubuntu2
libplasma-geolocation-interface4 - 4:4.10.90-0ubuntu2

No subscription required

criterions.comment: kde-workspace package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.10.90-0ubuntu2').
